Sentencas: Protonic ceramic fuel cells (PCFCs) have been the focus of research due to their advantageous properties compared to oxygen ion -conducting solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs).
Titulo: Surface reconfiguration on triple conductive perovskite cathode with exceptional electrocatalytic activity and stability for protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: However, the biggest obstacles to the development of PCFC are the lower proton conductivity and the poor stability in high concentration steam environment.
Titulo: Surface reconfiguration on triple conductive perovskite cathode with exceptional electrocatalytic activity and stability for protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, we report a novel composite cathode with surface reconfiguration, comprised of BaCoO3-delta (BCO) nanoparticles by water -induced precipitation and Ba0.9Pr0.1Co0.7Fe0.2Y0.1O3-delta (BPCFY) substrate with e(-)/ O2-/H+ triple conducting behavior, exhibiting high catalytic activity towards oxygen reduction reaction (ORR) and stability in high steam concentration.
Titulo: Surface reconfiguration on triple conductive perovskite cathode with exceptional electrocatalytic activity and stability for protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: With wet hydrogen (3 vol% H2O) as fuel and wet air (3 vol% H2O) as oxidant, the peak power density of NiO-BZCYYb|BZCYYb|BPCFY single cell reaches 750 m & sdot;cm(-2 )at 700 degrees C, approximately 25 % higher than that using dry air at cathode side.
Titulo: Surface reconfiguration on triple conductive perovskite cathode with exceptional electrocatalytic activity and stability for protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: Such improvement performance can be attributed to the precipitation of BaCoO3-delta nanoparticles that increase the active adsorption sites as well as the increased oxygen vacancy concentration by Pr doping in BaCo0.7Fe0.2Y0.1O3-delta, which synergistically expand the triple phase boundary and facilitate ions migration.
Titulo: Surface reconfiguration on triple conductive perovskite cathode with exceptional electrocatalytic activity and stability for protonic ceramic fuel cells

Sentencas: This work provided a promising approach to enhance the catalytic activity of PCFC at lower temperatures while also improving its tolerance to steam.
Titulo: Surface reconfiguration on triple conductive perovskite cathode with exceptional electrocatalytic activity and stability for protonic ceramic fuel cells
